title: What’s the BSL sign for ‘Throuple’?
description: How a collection of new signs were created to better reflect the LGBT community.

title: The neglected UK seaside town where locals think Nigel Farage can bring it back from dead
description: EXCLUSIVE: Nigel Farage's 'potential' constituents remain far more optimistic about the changes the ex-politician could bring, with polls also working in his favour.

title: Record 27 investors back call for Shell to align emissions target with Paris
description: The resolution, led by Dutch activist group Follow This, has been backed by Rathbones, Nest, Brunel and Amundi.

title: Cleverly moves to ban Islamist group Hizb ut-Tahrir as terror organisation
description: Security Minister Tom Tugendhat said the group “clearly encourage and promote terrorism” adding that their “celebration of Hamas’s appalling attacks on Israel, going so far as to call the terrorists who raped and murdered Israeli citizens ‘heroes’, is disgraceful.”

title: 'Who is going on strike on Thursday?' And other questions answered
description: The Department for Infrastructure said that "if the current weather warnings remain in place, we would advise people to avoid travel, if possible, on Thursday". It added that it won't know how many staff are aviailable until the strike happens so "it could be Thursday morning before the full impact will be known".

title: UK braces for coldest night of winter season with temperatures to drop to -15C
description: The UK is bracing for its coldest night of the winter season with temperatures set to drop to -15C in some places. A “cold plunge of Arctic air” has moved south across the whole country over the past few days, making it 5C-6C lower than usual for this time of year, the Met Office said.

title: Why did it take so long to ban this Islamist group?
description: The Islamist group Hizb ut-Tahrir has organised pro-Palestinian rallies with chants calling for jihad, or holy war, against Israel. Banning it, which the government has announced it will do, is long

title: Strengthening the Rwanda Bill is the only way path to victory
description: Securing our borders is a fundamental responsibility of any government. On a purely practical basis, properly enforced borders keep us all safe. On a theoretical level, a state cannot be a sovereign if it loses the power to determine who enters and leaves its territory.

title: Conservatives On Course For Worst Electoral Defeat Since 1997, New Poll Suggests
description: Sunak has said he plans to hold an election later in the year, which is widely expected to be in October or November, as a YouGov survey of 14,000 respondents forecasts that The Tories will hold on to just 169 seats,

title: The Development Of Artificial Intelligence Is Threatening 40% Of Jobs Worldwide
description: As world leaders discuss new AI regulation laws, an investigation found that the technology is set to affect almost half of the industries on a global scale.

title: ‘Hard to see any barriers for Stormont getting back to work’ – Heaton-Harris
description: The Secretary of State said he will introduce new primary legislation at Westminster next week if devolved government has not been restored.

title: Livestock export ban makes progress despite N Ireland ‘loophole’ fear
description: Attempts by the DUP to ensure Northern Ireland was incorporated in the Bill, including a bid for the export ban not to apply to the Republic of Ireland, failed on Monday. The DUPs

title: English Tory politicians running Facebook groups opposing 20mph in Wales while supporting it where they live
description: A Conservative councillor from Sunderland with no apparent links to Wales is running multiple Facebook groups opposing the 20mph limit here despite apparently supporting the limit in his hometown. A WalesOnline investigation has shown that the administrators of these social media groups have direct links to the Conservative Party.

title: YouGov poll predicts Lib Dem victory in Harrogate and Knaresborough
description: The Liberal Democrats are on course to gain Harrogate and Knaresborough from the Conservatives, according to the latest YouGov / MRP poll.

title: Sunak plays down dire poll figures amid warnings of election wipeout
description: A major opinion poll indicated Labour could be on course for a 120-seat majority in the election expected later this year.

title: Reform UK: the party frightening the Tories from the fringes
description: The rightwing populist party and successor to Ukip has Conservative voters in its sights. Ben Quinn reports

title: Livestock export ban makes progress despite N Ireland ‘loophole’ fear
description: MPs have approved a ban on exporting livestock for slaughter and fattening, amid warnings that a loophole could be created by Northern Ireland’s exclusion. The Animal Welfare (Livestock Exports) Bill seeks to prevent cattle, sheep, goats, pigs and horses being sent to the continent for slaughter from Great Britain.

title: Tory MPs told to ignore dire polling amid warnings of election wipeout
description: Tory MPs have been told by the party’s elections guru to ignore dire polling aimed at “undermining this Government” and warned that “divided parties fail”.

title: The latest on Israel's war in Gaza
description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said "nobody will stop us" from destroying Hamas as the war in Gaza passed the 100-day mark. Follow live updates.
